definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
to moisten/to grease/to apply (cream, ointment)/to dip a brush in ink

sentences.english: Pig ointment is one of them.
sentences.chinese: 猪油膏就是其中的一种。

sentences.english: For magic, ointments work best when applied to pulse points or chakras.
sentences.chinese: 在魔法仪式中把油膏涂在脉搏处将能最大发挥作用。

sentences.english: The father smeared the face of his son with a powerful unguent.
sentences.chinese: 父亲用一种非常有效的油膏涂抹在儿子的脸上。

sentences.english: My cup with blessings overflows, His oil anoints my head.
sentences.chinese: 祢用油膏了我的头，使我福杯满溢。

sentences.english: The paper introduces a non-filled dry central core optical fiber cable.
sentences.chinese: 介绍一种不填充油膏的干式中心管光缆。

sentences.english: They had dressed his varicose ulcer with soothing ointment.
sentences.chinese: 他们在静脉曲张的疮口上抹了清凉的油膏。

sentences.english: This ointment will subdue the inflammation.
My head Thou dost with oil anoint, and my cup overflows.
sentences.chinese: 祢用油膏了我的头，使我福杯满溢。

sentences.english: The paper presents a kind of semi-dry loose tube optical cable without filling compound in the core.
sentences.chinese: 介绍一种在缆芯中不填充油膏的半干式松管光缆。

sentences.english: A range of ointments and creams is available for the treatment of eczema.
sentences.chinese: 有一系列治疗湿疹的油膏和乳膏可以买到。

definition: to moisten/to grease/to apply (cream, ointment)/to dip a brush in ink
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
to paint/to smear/to apply (makeup etc)/to doodle/to erase/to obliterate
